Swachh Bharat Mission – Urban 2.0.details: The Swachh Bharat Mission – Urban 2.0 aims to eliminate open defecation and achieve 100% scientific management of municipal solid waste in urban areas. It focuses on constructing Individual Household Latrines (IHHLs), community and public toilets, and enhancing solid waste management systems.
benefits: Construction of Individual Household Latrines (IHHLs)
Development of community and public toilets
Improvement of solid waste management infrastructure
Promotion of source segregation and waste processing
eligibility: Urban households without access to proper sanitation facilities
application_process: Apply through the official SBM Urban Gujarat portal
Submit necessary documents (ID proof, address proof, income certificate)

Swachh Survekshan.details: Swachh Survekshan is an annual cleanliness survey conducted to assess the cleanliness and sanitation standards of cities across India. Gujarat has consistently ranked high in these surveys, with cities like Surat and Ahmedabad achieving top positions.
benefits: Recognition of clean cities
Incentives for top-performing cities
Encouragement for other cities to improve sanitation standards
eligibility: All cities and towns in Gujarat
application_process: Cities are assessed based on cleanliness parameters
No application required; participation is through performance

Nirmal Gujarat 2.0.details: Nirmal Gujarat 2.0 is an initiative by the Gujarat government to strengthen the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan on a broader scale. It focuses on promoting clean toilets, integrated waste management, and the overall cleanliness of urban areas.
benefits: Promotion of clean toilets
Integrated waste management systems
Overall cleanliness and hygiene in urban areas
application_process: Apply through the official SBM Urban Gujarat portal

Municipal Solid Waste Management Project.details: The MSWMP aims to develop the Solid Waste Management (SWM) sector in Gujarat. It focuses on improving waste collection, transportation, processing, and disposal systems in urban areas.
benefits: Improved waste collection and transportation systems
Enhanced waste processing and disposal facilities
Reduction in environmental pollution
eligibility: Municipalities and Municipal Corporations in Gujarat
application_process: Submit proposals to the Urban Development Department
Receive funding and support for implementation

Waste to Energy Policy – 2016.details: The Waste to Energy Policy – 2016 encourages the establishment of waste-to-energy plants in Gujarat. It aims to utilize Municipal Solid Waste (MSW) for generating electricity, promoting renewable energy and reducing landfill usage.
benefits: Generation of electricity from MSW
Reduction in landfill usage
Promotion of renewable energy sources
eligibility: Private and public entities interested in setting up waste-to-energy plants in Gujarat
application_process: Submit proposals to the Gujarat Pollution Control Board

Swachhta Hi Seva.details: Swachhta Hi Seva is a cleanliness drive expanded by the Gujarat government to include solid waste management in villages. It involves door-to-door collection of solid waste and its disposal at nearby municipal dumping sites.
benefits: Improved waste collection and disposal in rural areas
Enhanced cleanliness and hygiene in villages
Reduction in open dumping and pollution
eligibility: Villages within a 5 km radius around 'A' class municipalities
application_process: Participate in cleanliness drives organized by local authorities
Follow guidelines for waste segregation and disposal

Gujarat State Urban Solid Waste Manageme.details: This policy provides a framework for urban local bodies in Gujarat to manage solid waste and sanitation effectively. It emphasizes waste segregation, processing, and disposal, aiming to achieve a clean and healthy urban environment.
benefits: Structured approach to solid waste management
Emphasis on waste segregation and processing
Improved sanitation standards in urban areas
application_process: Implement the policy guidelines in urban areas
Monitor and report progress to the Urban Development Department
